There are some quirks with the roles search path. If not found in the `roles` subdir, the basedir is also searched. In a collection if you have a `.` in the role name it's another directory layer - `geerlingguy.docker` in a collection should refer to `geerlingguy/docker/` not `geerlingguy.docker/`. `ansible-doc` doesn't need all of it, but it might be worth refactoring [_load_role_path](https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/playbook/role/definition.py#L137) to move the search path resolution (and maybe the role path loading?) to common code so everything stays in sync.

Hrm, I'm probably being dense here, so you may have to help me out. Not sure I follow the statement...

  `If not found in the roles subdir, the basedir is also searched.`

Is my code doing that, or code elsewhere? I don't see where that is done, and doesn't seem like correct behavior for finding roles.

The logic I've added here searches for roles in:

- DEFAULT_ROLES_PATH
- the `roles` subdir of whatever value is passed to `--playbook-dir` (which is `basedir` in this portion of the code)
- the value of `--roles-path`
- the `roles` subdir of any collections that are found.

Failing to see where the collection bit you discussed fits in, too.   :(
FYI, the collection bit fits in here https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/playbook/role/definition.py#L159

I've added searching the playbook basedir as a last-resort in the latest commits. Thanks for seeing that undocumented behavior! I totally missed it.

After looking through the code in _load_role_path() and related bits, there is a lot of commonality, but there is also a lot of stuff happening there that ansible-doc doesn't necessarily need to do. We definitely should work to consolidate this code, but I think attempting to do so here would make this already large change much more complex. I think that should be a separate project (to be done soon, hopefully).

Agreed- trying to refactor/share the common bits is probably out of scope for this PR. If we end up doing the `importlib.resources` stuff though, that's probably the place to step back and take a look at where we can share a bunch of this stuff between the runtime and docs generation, and try to come up with a more coherent generalized API.
